question_text: Why is VM escape considered one of the most dangerous vulnerabilities in virtualization?
answer_options: It allows a user to gain administrator access inside the VM
It causes denial-of-service attacks against the hypervisor
It enables malware to access other VMs or the host through the hypervisor
It prevents the VM from booting independently
correct_answer: It enables malware to access other VMs or the host through the hypervisor
explanation: VM escape breaks the isolation model of virtualization, allowing cross-VM or VM-to-host compromise.
